meanings.definition: A baby carriage or stroller used for transporting infants.
meanings.sent1: The perambulators lined up neatly outside the daycare.
meanings.sent2: She pushed the perambulators through the park, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The perambulators seemed to have a secret meeting by the swings.
meanings.sent4: The row of perambulators resembled a colorful train on wheels.
meanings.sent5: The perambulators were like cozy little nests for the babies.

meanings.definition: A device used for measuring distances by walking around the boundaries of an area.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor used perambulators to map out the land accurately.
meanings.sent2: The perambulators clicked with each step as the surveyor walked the perimeter.
meanings.sent3: The perambulators seemed to have a mind of their own, guiding the surveyor along.
meanings.sent4: The perambulators painted an invisible line on the ground as they rolled.
meanings.sent5: The perambulators helped measure the field with precision.

meanings.definition: A person who walks or travels on foot.
meanings.sent1: The perambulators strolled along the beach, enjoying the sunset.
meanings.sent2: She was a dedicated perambulator, exploring new paths every day.
meanings.sent3: The perambulators raced each other to the top of the hill.
meanings.sent4: The perambulators moved gracefully through the city streets, never in a rush.
meanings.sent5: The perambulators were known for their leisurely pace and love of walking.
